abstract: New York State Education Dept announces plan to shorten standardized tests for third through eighth grade students for second time since adopting Common Core standards in 2013 and says tests will be further trimmed in 2017; move may not be enough to appease parents who are opposed to tests altogether.
lead_paragraph: The State Education Department said that the tests for third through eighth graders would be shortened next spring, and that they would be trimmed further in 2017.

headline.main: New York Will Trim Common Core Exams After Many Students Skipped Them
headline.print_headline: New York to Shorten Common Core Exams That 20% of Students Skipped This Year
